Kara is a great host and is quick to respond to questions. Thank you for sharing your beautiful A-Frame Haus with us, Kara!

Group trip
review_text: The most idyllic little a frame in Heber. No detail is spared in Kara’s cabin. The aesthetic and finishes are unmatched. It is warm, cozy, and just feels like home. The beds and linens were a dream while falling asleep looking out the many skylights connecting you with the nature surrounding. Many cups of coffee and glasses of wine were enjoyed while starting and ending our days on the beautiful back deck. If you want to feel like you have truly escaped but still have the convenience of being just outside of town, this is the spot for you.

Stayed a few nights
review_text: The cabin was cute and well maintained, with great bathrooms and kitchen. It was very clean, including the deck, and there were fewer insects than expected. Kara was a great host - very fast and friendly responses to my questions/comments but with limited expectations and demands on me, which made for a comfortable and stress free stay. I was a little disappointed about the level of road noise heard inside and outside the cabin, but I’m assuming this depends a bit on the time of year (perhaps an unusual amount of side by sides around Labor Day, for example).

review_text: Kara was extremely responsive. We had to cancel the trip due to coronavirus situation and Kara was extremely sympathetic. She waived the cancellation policy and provided the full refund to us. It was much appreciated. In the midst of this challenging situation, it is good to know there are great people out there who would make things a little bit better for others. Thank you, Kara. We will definitely try to find another opportunity to stay with Kara in the future.

Being in the A-frame Haus during a snow storm was great fun!

As others have mentioned, the water does have a sulfuric smell to it, but it wasn't too bothersome and bottled water was provided. Kara was very quick to respond with any questions we had. We will definitely be back!

My only gripe would be no door on the upstairs bathroom or bedroom, I get it was for space, but I am a fan of just a wee bit of privacy. Kara responded quickly and everything was just picture perfect. I would definitely stay there again!

review_text: Cute cute cabin! The upstairs was pretty hot so turn on the AC as soon as you arrive to try and cool it down... we had the sliding door open at night, but closed it due to some spider friends coming inside. Otherwise a great stay! Kara provided bottled water for us which was super helpful. Beautiful views. Not really anywhere to play outside (the brush is super thick and high), but we went into town to play at the park and ride the Heber Creeper Train. Great cabin for playing board games and watching the sunset and relaxing. Kara was a great host!

If you're looking for something tranquil, that evokes slow-living and calmness look no further! The cabin is located on a private lot and is super close to Sundance, Park City and a reservoir that you can paddleboard/boat/kayak for miles! Enjoy, thanks Kara!!

I would definitely recommend!

review_text: Cozy, clean and very comfortable! It’s light, airy and so relaxing, easy check in with the lock box, and our 3 kids had so much fun exploring and loved taking walks down to the river that is just a short distance from the cabin. We brought our side by side and rode trails near by and one of our favorite, Snake Creek above Midway- less than 30 min drive. Great places to go out and eat that are fairly close but you still feel secluded from near by towns. Our kids were so sad to leave and we really enjoyed our time at the A-frame!

Also while the skylights are beautiful it would be really nice to have some kind of shade covering in the bedrooms. All in all we enjoyed our stay.

This cabin with its amazing floor to A line ceiling glass, washes the whole space in natural light while the clean modern touches compliments the space like no other cabin out there. Even close enough to charming towns like heber or midway if you feel like venturing to the more populated human side.

Location was a bit out of the way but close enough to the town center and a reasonable drive to Park City, but it's perfect if you just need some time away and clear some headspace. Thank you, Kara!

name: Javi
rating_info:
Rating, 4 stars
,
·
May 2019
,
·
Stayed with kids
review_text:
The cabin is wonderful. It has an outstanding style which makes it perfect to spend your day reading, cooking, writing, just being inside. The location is also great, you are actually close to Heber but it looks like if you were in the middle of nowhere. Whereas going outdoors could be appealing, its wonderful interior will make you want to stay inside the cabin enjoying the nature through the big window of the living room. That is the biggest pro to me.
However if our stay was not perfect was because some amenities (stove, dvd and grill) did not work well. We also had an unexpected guest (mouse) which was more a surprise than an issue since we understand it can happen in a cabin like this. Nevertheless, when you pay such an amount of money you expect everything to be perfect. It was not the case. We informed the host about these problems the night before our departure. Being true there was probably not time to fix it, we would have appreciated they had made the effort to try it and not just an apologize text.

We'll be back for another stay for sure.

Kara definitely has it all down:) checking in was easy and she communicated fast and nicely. Thanks again!

name: Matthew
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
April 2018
,
·
Stayed with kids
review_text: This Airbnb has a page to follow on Instagram with fun pictures of the remodel and pictures from people who’ve stayed before. It’s really such a beautiful cabin right off the road, it was super easy to find. It’s completely been remodeled and is stunning. It’s super clean and had everything we needed. They provided linen, towels, even shampoo and conditioner. It has a fully stocked kitchen. We were able to prepare breakfast and dinner in the spacious kitchen. They have a drawer full of games and dvds and kid toys which was a bonus! It was warm when we got there, especially upstairs but the cabin has a Nest and only took 30 minutes to cool down. Check-in and check-out was super simple. She gives you the key box code and you go right in and lock up when you leave. She only asks that you take out your garbages and put your dishes in the dishwasher before you leave. Overall I loved our stay and I highly recommend. We will definitely be returning in the future.

This space is even more magical in person! We had a group of three girls and decided to do a mini weekend trip and the A-Frame Haus was the perfect stay. It was much larger than you'd expect an A-frame to be (can probably accomodate 6 people comfortably), extremely clean and well-stocked with all the necessary items (shampoo, clean towels, coffee, The Office DVD's), and the views were just great. The best part of all this is the host, Kara. We notified her that we'd be coming in very late at night due to a late flight and she drove up to leave the lights on for us so we wouldn't have any issues finding the house. She responds quickly and provides all information clearly.
I will definitely have to come back. Highly recommended!

There was also a bunch of games and puzzles—we worked on the 2 puzzles and played some Uno :) Location-wise, the cabin is pretty secluded, but still close enough to spots like Park City and Sundance.
The interior of the cabin is as dreamy as it looks in the pictures. We would definitely stay here again!

We very much enjoyed our stay at the A Frame house. It’s in a beautiful setting and very quaint. The aesthetic is wonderful! We felt like it was secluded but glad that many amenities were just 10 minutes away.
Kara is a lovely host. She was patient and helpful when we had questions and concerns. She was also very understanding with us about an issue we had that was not communicated prior to arrival. She worked with us to get the situation resolved in a very generous and thoughtful way.
My only heads-up comment would be that there is not a washer/ dryer on the premises, and although the listing doesn’t say there is one in the amenities section, I just assumed. Which was my bad.
Overall a wonderful experience.

Her place was stylish and clean and kept us warm, while the temperatures outside were a little nippy. I would recommend this place to families or for a group of friends traveling together and want to be tucked away, but just close enough to the city!

review_text:
This was an exceptional place to stay. The house is amazing and very well done. We stayed there with our 4 kids and everyone loved it. The kids enjoyed playing in the little nook above the upstairs bed, and they really enjoyed hiking down to the creek bed just below the house to go exploring. There's no water this time of year but they collected rocks and sticks and had a great time.
My wife really enjoyed the kitchen and cooked meals every night. Everything she needed was there. Everything is well furnished and decorated.
The proximity to downtown Heber is very nice. It feels like you are further away than you are. Just a quick drive in to get ice cream or anything else you need.
Garrett & Kara were always very responsive and polite with any questions we had.
We will definitely be going back.

name: Jj
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars

·
July 2017
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: Secluded but within proximity to Heber and Park City (and plenty of outdoor activities), the location of A-frame Haus is incredible for your next getaway. But it is the architecture, design, and overall feel that will have you falling in love with this place. There is attention to detail everywhere, but it doesn't deliver a busy feeling, more so a minimalistic, peaceful one. The style is sophisticated but comfortable and the white, beach cabin-esque open areas serve as blank slate for new ideas or forgetting your troubles. The hosts are so friendly and were quick to respond to any questions I had. They live nearby and can be at your service in a jiff. Also noteworthy about them, you really just feel like you have known them for years once you meet them. I can't wait to go back. -JJ

Just spending time in the house itself is an experience and I think it is an ideal location for a family reunion, romantic getaway or any other experience that is focused on intentional quality time with people you love!

review_text: Absolutely beautiful property. There’s something about the location itself that calms you. You’re surrounded by trees and green fields with a beautiful mountain view. The place was pristine clean and the bed in the theater room was made up which made us feel welcomed right away. The theater room was spacious and cozy. The kitchen was well equipped with everything you’d need even kid friendly dishes, and bakeware. The gas stove was a nice perk. And the shower was heavenly. The attention to detail was greatly appreciated as there were clear instructions on how to operate everything. Sitting around the fire with tons of firewood to roast marshmallows with was a wonderful experience. Our favorite thing was hopping inside the hot tub every night. What a way to relax. Really set us up for a good night’s sleep. Another favorite was having breakfast outside on the patio furniture. We enjoyed every minute and can’t wait to be back!

Great place! Very clean and has everything you need. The host was available if we needed something.
We cooked all our meals there. The theater room was really nice and the hot tub was clean and refreshing. We enjoyed the Heber area and went to the Crater to swim. We went on a hike in the snow at Wasatch State Park. We also found a shooting range at Big Hollow. This is great space and we would definitely reserve again.

review_text: Oh my goodness I can’t say enough about Jake and Amanda’s place. Peaceful and private location. We loved the views, the hot tub, centrality to so many wonderful places (we went to Park City for drinks and shopping)…Wasatch Mountain State Park for hiking/snowshoeing thanks to the recommendation from Amanda…and took our last day to drive to Solitude for skiing (but even more skiing closer). The hosts were attentive and quick to respond. The place was perfect and the amenities were wonderful (fire pit with wood, hot tub, TV room, fireplace, toiletries, coffee) all the big and little things just really made the stay! Will definitely be back!

Stayed with kids
review_text:
Jake and Amanda have created a beautiful getaway that was perfect for our little family. The kids had a great time playing in the yard and playground, roasting marshmallows in the fire pit, exploring on the trail and watching movies in the home theater. The work they put into the property is very apparent and has created a tranquil place to stay.
A vey welcome surprise was how well the hosts treated any questions we might arise from us guests. They left laminated instructions highlighted everything from controlling the air conditioning to using the hot tub and the home theater which was extremely helpful.
Lastly, the hosts were very accommodating, communicative and responsive. We will definitely be coming back to stay here the next time we visit if we can and I would recommend the same to anyone.

We would not hesitate to book again and recommend to others. Thank you Jake!

In a beautiful location and an amazing neighborhood. The rental itself was spotless and everything felt very nice inside. The home theater was a real treat too!
One thing that I saw at least one other reviewer mention too is that you don’t really have full (any?) control over the cooling/heating system within the place. The vents were blowing cold air when I had the thermostat off. Fortunately the owner was out of town so they were able to have someone local come over to turn off the upstairs system and that resolved the issue for me.

review_text:
Stayed here for a little R&R and it didn’t disappoint. The hot tub was really nice, clean and secluded. The theater room was so much fun and easy to use. The property backs a large open undeveloped area where we had plenty of deer visit each day. The place is very clean with nice amenities like a convection oven/microwave, rainfall shower, echo dot for music, fireplace, leather recliners, 3 rows of theater seating with one folding out to a bed, large picture window that made it nice and bright, dedicated parking area and separate entrance. Great location to get away but within 10 minutes to downtown Heber.
Definitely recommend staying at Jake’s place and would book it again.

Thank you Jake, we can’t wait to come back!

Jake does specify that his family with kids live upstairs and to expect some noise, but we found that the noise was only noticeable during the early evening when we were up making noise of our own. The apartment was cozy, and we had beautiful views out of every window (including horsies in neighboring ranches). We got to play in the snow right outside, there was a lot of open space if you wanted to build a snowman or have a snowball fight.
Parking was super easy and comfortable. Midway was lovely, and we got a full 4 days of activities just in the local area.
Highly recommend this stay!

Melynne’s home was better than described and pictured. The home instructions emailed ahead of time were spot on and we loved the keyless entry. She was an exceptional host and communication was easy.
We were less than 1/2 mile to the Homestead Crater. Our primary trip goal was for my 16 year old nephew to become Open Water Dive certified. Which we accomplished - yay! Melynne’s home was the perfect “home” away from home to relax. The kitchen was one of the best stocked kitchens I’ve seen at Airbnb rentals, although we didn’t use anything because the suggested restaurants in town were delicious! Great host, crater and town. We would highly recommend and would definitely return! If your trip involves the Crater, Rich and Lori are amazing!!!!

Checkin was super easy and I greeted by Christmas songs 🎄
Melynne’s place is awesomely beautiful, I can see mountains from the right and left windows
Place is quiet, peaceful and super clean.
I definitely will recommend this place to the scuba shop I took my certification with and would bring my husband to stay here if we ever coming back to Midway!

Rating, 5 stars
,

1 week ago
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Jeannine’s Zen Den was perfect for us. We couldn’t ask for anything more in an Airbnb. This is not only now our favorite place to stay in the Heber/Park City general area, but it is easily in our top three Airbnbs.
Here are some examples of the nice things we experienced:
1. Personal welcome note inside
2. Rack for shoes at the entrance
3. Refrigerator with a good freezer - we love ice!
4. Convenient washer/dryer
5. Notification of some cool local events
6. Nice temperature control system
7. Sound machine for sleeping
8. Comfortable bed, sheets, and pillows
9. Nice shower and tub
10. Very peaceful and quiet
We basically needed a place to sleep and get cleaned up, so we didn’t use the full-size kitchen and well-furnished TV room, but if someone also needed those then this place would be awesome for that.
Jeannine is an excellent host.

Loved waking up in the morning to see the hot air balloons in the sky and the gorgeous mountains. Plus you literally drive right by Dutch Bros Coffee on your way out to your adventures. Stayed a few nights
review_text: The photos of the Zen Den don't do justice for how peaceful this little escape is. The Zen Den is in one of the most convenient locations in Heber, right near anything you'd ever need, and it's well-stocked with all the basics (plus some) you'd need to feel at home. The entire suite was spotlessly clean, welcoming, and quiet, and the bed was divinely comfortable. There were cooking utensils in kitchen drawers, a mini pantry of non-perishable essentials in the cupboard, and a full-sized fridge with a variety of condiments. Jeannine was a fantastic host—she replied to messages immediately, and she was respectful of our privacy while also eager to help with anything she could. Overall, it was very comforting to know we had this safe place to stay while visiting family in town. We'd love to stay again were we invited back.

review_text:
Beautiful basement apartment, I didn’t know what to expect when I rented a basement , I live in Texas and we don’t have basements , so I thought it was going to be dark , but it was the opposite! The apartment has windows which i personally liked.
The apartment was spotless clean!
The linens are amazingly soft !!!
Other nice touch was , multiple Kleenex boxes which come very handy when the weather is freezing outside.
The heated floor omg!!! Amazing .
We will be coming back !
Location: close to many restaurants, grocery stores and many things to do around the area with in minutes.
We traveled with 2 kids 5 and 8
We visited the cheese farm ? Kids loved !!! Hanging out with the cows and see with their own eyes farm to table milk process.
We also visited the crater in homestead, took a train tour by the lake , had lunch ate the cafe galleria in Midway.
20 minutes from Park city and 38 from salt lake .
So if you like to explore, Mariah’s places is the perfect spot to stay.

review_text:
The place looks just like the photos. Mariah has added touches that made the stay feel high end - plenty of spices in the kitchen, decent cooking utensils, quality linens, fresh robes, shampoo, conditioner, & body wash in the shower, cozy throw blanket for the couch, easy outlets for phone charging.
Other reviews made me a little nervous so I’ll add the bed was slightly more firm than my purple mattress. We slept great! And the sound proofing of the house is great! We heard very little from upstairs except a few muffled running steps of their toddler during the day.
I was able to get a 90 min massage from Mariah during my stay. I would highly recommend it! Her rates are a steal. She was communicative ahead of time about logistics and arrived on time. Her easy manner put me right at ease. She varied the pressure to my needs and incorporated these beautiful extras that made it feel very spa like (aromatherapy, heated table, hot stones, and even a hot towel for my feet!)

We absolutely loved our stay at Mariah’s place. Everything was brand new and spotless. Mariah had detailed information for us at a table by the front door. It was so nice to have everything laid out for us so that all of our questions were answered right there. The place had lots of little extras that I enjoyed. My favorite was walking into the bathroom and finding that the floor was heated. Being from Arizona that’s not something we experience. It was so nice and toasty. I also loved the bamboo wash cloths that were provided for taking off your make up. It felt like we were at a spa. In fact, I have ordered some for myself now at home.
Mariah was great to communicate with us when we had questions. I loved that she let us know about a local festival happening in town that weekend. We attended the festival and had a great time.
We enjoyed our little home away from home for the weekend. We liked hanging out and just playing games and being together. Amazing weekend. We’ll return!

name: Marcy Jean
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
November 2021
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: Our stay with Mariah was fantastic! We loved the beautiful new, clean space she created which had a very spa-like atmosphere and was very soothing and calming to be in. The kitchen has all new appliances and had everything we needed to prepare meals during our stay. The bathroom is functional, elegant and warmed with heat lamps and the added surprise comfort of radiant heated floors! My friend, who stayed in the bedroom, repeatedly commented on how comfortable the bed was and the pull out couch in the living room provided both a large comfortable sleeping area for me and a nice place to watch movies with my friends. Communication with Mariah was friendly, prompt and accommodating in all instances. The two friends who shared this space with me during this visit both asked me for Mariah's contact information for future visits to Heber for other friends and family. Mariah is also a massage therapist and offers massage by appointment to those who would like that. While I didn't have time to take advantage of this, this option is definitely an added plus to staying in this space. After thoroughly searching for AirBnB accommodations in Heber City, the value for the price is also second to none. There is no need to search for a better place to stay in Heber, you've already found it!

However, the road noise is quite loud but couldn't hear it from inside. The smart thermostat is easy to navigate but only allowed to turn down to 69 and only for 3 hours before it returned to the default 72 so I woke up hot to reset it. It should be noted that this condo is on the 3rd floor and it's 1 mile plus walk to main street so I wouldn't consider this location walkable. Great hosts, very responsive with clear check-in and out instructions. Overall, great property!

The apartment is on the third floor so get ready for some good exercise going up the stairs :).
The location is easy to find and set on the outskirt of Heber so you don't have as business of the city. The area location has a lot of new construction but it wasn't bad. Definitely would recommend staying here and working with the hosts.

It felt a little weird to us. Again I definitely didn’t read that there wasn’t a door and only a curtain for a door (until we got there) so just make sure to read all of the descriptions. Just with 3 woman we felt a little unsafe knowing anyone could come downstairs and we didn’t have a door or anything. But if you don’t care about that then it’s totally fine! review_text:
We spent several days at Ross’s place and would definitely recommend it.
The entire place was comfortable, and inviting. Check in was easy and effortless.
I am personally someone who doesn’t feel comfortable staying at my friend’s house, much less a complete stranger, but I was completely comfortable at this rental.
The pool table was fun, and utilized. Coffee pot was small enough to please the coffee drinkers in our group, but not large enough to waste coffee.
I really liked having the fridge with the built in ice maker, and water.
The rooms were very spacious, and the single bathroom was perfect. Someone could take a shower while someone else was using the sink area, and it wasn’t an inconvenience.
Great place to lay your head while exploring the area.

I would HIGHLY recommend this property. Even though it is in Heber City, I found it easy to drive to Park City for skiing. The surrounding community is quaint and friendly. Ross was also so accommodating with our mountain bikes being safely stored & replied promptly to messages. The neighborhood was easy to navigate (maps took me right there). It was a little difficult to find the house itself as it was dark & not many street lights, but that’s on me because we arrived much later than planned & I have terrible night vision. It was much easier in the morning light to easily see the house and numbers. Would most definitely stay here again next time we come up to Heber City.

review_text: Last year, we rented an Airbnb in SLC (which was great), but this trip we were doing winter activities (x-country skiing and snowmobiling) both southeast of SLC, and booked Ross's place in Heber. Pictures and descriptions looked too good to be true, but ALL WAS SPOT ON! The full kitchen, comfy leather sectional, large smart TV's in all rooms, pool table, comfy king beds, large bathroom with good water pressure were as described and amazing. While there, we took ski lessons at the Soldiers Hollow Nordic Center, snowmobiled out at Daniels Summit Lodge, and took two trips to Park City, and all were super easy to get to and only 20-25 minutes away. I absolutley would recommend Ross's Airbnb, and hopefully it is available the next time we visit the Beehive State!

A thick curtain covers the entryway at the bottom of the stairs to provide added privacy.
For being 20 minutes outside of Park City, this was a really great value for our ski trip.

review_text: A home away from home! This spacious cottage is such a gem. We absolutely loved every bit of our stay and hated to leave. The bed is SUPER COMFORTABLE, the decor is cozy and tasteful, the kitchen has everything you would need. The cottage is 20 minutes from Sundance Ski Resort and 25 minutes from Park City, making a ski trip super easy when you want to ski, but far enough that you are not bombarded by crowds. Heber City is cute, with a great local market, coffee shops and restaurants. Dustin was very friendly, helpful, and communicative. If you are looking for a cozy cottage retreat, look no further. We can't wait to come back!

Stayed about a week
review_text: Fantastic. The perfect intersection of quality and value. The house is well-equipped with high-quality linens, a comfortable bed, and nice bath products. We used the kitchen nearly every night and there was actual nice cookware (not just the cheapest items from ikea present in many airbnbs) as well as spices. Heber City is an established town with many shops and grocery stores, yet the cottage is on a residential street that was very quiet at night. Best of all are the hosts, who are kind, responsive, and live right next door—we felt like we were visiting extended family! Skiing at Park City was an easy 20 minute drive. Recommended!

name: Samantha
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars

Stayed with kids
review_text: This is the second time we’ve stayed at Jace’s Chick’s Cafe Loft. It’s such a cute little place. There are 2 bedrooms and one bathroom. Laundry services on site. Two couches in the living area that fold down into beds. We try to do a little wintery “staycation” every January/February, and Jace’s place is perfect for this. We’re from Cottonwood Heights, so we’re about a 45 minute drive away. This location is right in the middle of all the the awesome things you can do in the Heber valley. We went to the Ice Castles, swam in the Homestead Crater, toured a dairy farm, rode the Heber Creeper train, and ate pizza at Cafe Galleria in an alpenglobe. This is just an awesome place. The kids beg to come here. Your stay also includes a $20 voucher to eat at Chick’s Cafe. We just have so much fun every time we stay here! 10/10. Will stay again.

review_text:
This place is absolutely stunning! It was perfect for our family of six, with kids ranging in age from 4 to 14. It is VERY clean. We personally loved the location. The kitchen is well stocked and there are plenty of towels and extra linens.
There were a couple of complaints from others reviews that I thought may have been potential issues, but they seem to have been addressed or resolved before we arrived. The first one was that people mention that it was very noisy because it’s on Main street. That may be the case but it was not a deterrent at all for our young family. There is a white noise machine that we used for our kids and everything was just fine. We really did not notice the street noise at all.
Also someone had mentioned that the stairway up to the unit is very dark. Actually, it is very well lit. There is a light switch at the bottom and then another one at the top inside the unit, so lighting was not an issue at all.
Jace and Jordan are great hosts!

It was just my son and I, but we could easily fit our family of five, and still not feel cramped! Clean, decorated perfectly, comfortable beds, and centrally located! We will be back!

name: William
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
September 2021
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
My wife and I stayed for 3 nights. Great stay!! Perfect location for seeing the area!! We hiked a local state park and drove the incredibly scenic Mirror Lake Hwy and Guardsman Pass. Park City is 20-minute drive. The included meal voucher was perfect for a delicious and filling breakfast for 2 at Chick's Cafe. Melvin's is a short walk and was a friendly stop for a beer and appetizer. Heber Valley Brewing was a nice stop as well, less than a 15 minute walk up Main St. We can also recommend Bagel Den for breakfast. Back 40 Ranch House Grill had great food, service and views for our 31st wedding anniversary dinner.
About the host and space: the host was great and provided everything we needed for our stay. Communication was great. Check-in was easy (tip: if the stairway is dark on the way up to the loft, there is a light switch at the bottom of the stairs). We had a few questions after check-in, and Jordan responded almost immediately. There is plenty of free street parking or you can park around back. Plenty of K-Cups were provided for the coffee maker. The space is exactly as shown in the pictures, clean, comfy, and nicely renovated (note: there is no dishwasher, which didn't bother us).
Final notes: There are 19 steps from the street to the loft. That's OK with us but could be a consideration for others. The water pressure was a non-issue. The periods of low pressure last less than 30 seconds, but it's good to know about it in advance so no surprises. Also, Main Street is a 4-lane highway through town. You will hear it in the front living space, but not from the rear bedrooms.

review_text: The Loft was perfect for my wife and I for our quick trip to Utah for a wedding in Midway. Check-in was as easy as it gets and Jordan communicated well and was very responsive. We both had to laugh as we tried to take showers mid-day to get ready for the wedding. Unfortunately, we timed it perfectly with the Cafe running their dishwasher which literally took all the water pressure away from the shower. There are several signs warning us this could happen so we were not surprised. Chick’s Cafe breakfast was very good. Thanks for providing the great space. If we are ever back in the area, we will stay there again.

name: McKenna
rating_info:
Rating, 4 stars
,
·
April 2021
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: We stayed in the loft checking in on a Saturday and checking out on a Tuesday. Check in instructions were easy to follow. I was worried with this being right above the cafe that it might smell like a fryer/ the restaurant below. It does smell like the restaurant in the hallway leading up to the loft and a bit inside the loft. The smell, while noticeable, wasn't terrible to begin with but if it's too much for you they also have one of the wax warmers in the loft to combat the smell. In our 4 day stay we only used it twice. The location right on main street is easy to get to, and central to other activities. Parking was rarely an issue. However, the loft is on mainstreet and it sounds like it's right on main street. You can hear the traffic from the street and them setting up in the morning at the restaurant throughout the loft so if noise is an issue for you when you sleep you would want to bring ear plugs. They have a nice TV in the loft which we were able to hook our Xbox to. I think the TV is a smart TV that comes equipped with the streaming apps that you can log into. They have a washer and dryer in the loft and also provider detergent. We brought our own shampoo and conditioner because I have very long thick hair and the tiny bottles aren't enough for me. However, they had full sized bottles of shampoo and conditioner so you can save the space in your luggage. They have hangars in the closet so you can take your close out of your bag and air them out. They also have a guide to Heber city which was super helpful! Overall we enjoyed our stay and the meal voucher was a nice plus and a great way to finish out our trip. The $20 voucher is given to you at the beginning and can be used anytime during your stay. We just chose to use it as our last hurrah and it provided for an excellent breakfast.

name: Paul & LaRhonda Whitmire
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,

April 2021
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: This place i would give 5 stars on everything. It's in a historic building downtown but newly renovated upstairs loft. Perfect location in the central business district downtown. You can pretty much walk to any place in town. Perfect neighborhoods to walk in and close to the park. You can't go wrong with this place. Highly recommended !

name: Joann
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
April 2021
,
·
Stayed over a week
review_text: We stayed for 4 weeks and the loft was a perfect place to stay so that we could ski at four different mountains. The loft gets great light and there are great views of the mountains once you're on Main St. Multiple restaurants to choose from within walking distance. We ate at Chick's Cafe each week. In-unit laundry was so convenient. The loft was beautifully renovated and feels very comfortable. Jordan was so quick and easy to communicate with. He bought an iron and ironing board for the loft when I asked if I could borrow one from him. We loved our time at the loft and would happily stay here again.

name: Corie
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
March 2021
,
·
Stayed over a week
review_text: I stayed here for a month and would definitely go back. The space was really large and well designed/laid out. The ceilings are pretty high and there were a lot of windows so it was bright and airy. Internet speed was great. It was on a main road, but I never had a problem with noise - the bedrooms are all in the back and it was extremely quiet. The location was good too - lots of hiking trails around and a short drive to park city and deer valley. I also went to snowbird, Alta and solitude while there and none were that far away. If you go to deer valley there is a gondola about ten minutes down the road which takes you over the hill and onto the mountain. Very friendly and helpful hosts too.

Got my parents a trip to this loft for Christmas and they absolutely loved it! They said it’s newly remodeled, beautiful and clean. It was the perfect relaxing weekend in an adorable part of town.
Jace was so easy and helpful to work with. Can’t recommend enough

Some quirks - at times water pressure so low that you had to wait to wash your hands and kitchen a bit sparsely equipped if you do a lot of cooking. Overall we loved our weekend and would rent again.

name: Jason
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
December 2020
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: The place was extremely clean, parking was easy, and great access to the ski areas. Only a 20 minute drive to Park City and 10 minutes from the Deer Valley gondola. There are plenty of restaurants, bars, and a grocery store within walking distance. The only negative comments I have is the apartment is located on a busy road with a lot of road noise so any guests sleeping on the pullout sofas may have a hard time sleeping with the noise. The bedrooms are on the backside so road noise isn't an issue. Also there are some water pressure issues in the shower from the Cafe below but it's manageable. Overall, I would definitely recommend this loft apartment.

It’s right on the Main Street in Heber making it convenient. We were able to make meals with the kitchen and even went down to the cafe. Great hosts to work with by responding quickly.
